Question: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException why?: :The error is: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerExceptionI would like to make a tic tac toe console game for my university. This is the code belowthe main program:import acm.program.*;public class askisi1d extends Program {    public void run(){        tictac player[];        player=new tictac[2];        player[0]=new tictac("baggelis");        player[1]=new tictac("Giorgaras");        player[0].setMove("1 2");        println(tictac.drawTable());    }}This is the class code:import java.util.*;import acm.program.*;public class tictac{    private String name;    int [][]table=new int [][]{    {8,1,6},    {3,5,7},    {4,9,2}    };    int activePlayer;    boolean [][]takenSquare= new boolean [2][2];    int [][]playerTable; //gia tin niki    static tictac[] player;    private int row;  //<---    private  int col;  //""    public tictac(String name){        this.name=name;        playerTable=new int[2][2];        activePlayer=0;    }    public boolean isValidMove(int row,int col){        return (row>0&&row<4&&col>0&&col<4&&takenSquare[row-1][col-1]==false);    }//isValidmove    public void setMove (String move){        StringTokenizer tokenizer=new StringTokenizer(move);        this.row= Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());        this.col= Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());        if (isValidMove(row-1,col-1)){            player[activePlayer].takenSquare[row-1][col-1]=true;            player[activePlayer].playerTable[row-1][col-1]=table[row-1][col-1];        }        activePlayer=1-activePlayer;    }    public static String drawTable(){        String a="";        a+=(drawSquare(0,0)+"|");        a+=(drawSquare(0,1)+"|");        a+=(drawSquare(0,2)+'\n');        a+=("-----------")+'\n';        a+=drawSquare(1,0)+"|";        a+=drawSquare(1,1)+"|";        a+=(drawSquare(1,2)+'\n');        a+=("-----------")+'\n';        a+=drawSquare(2,0)+"|";        a+=drawSquare(2,1)+"|";        a+=(drawSquare(2,2));        return"a";    }    public static String drawSquare(int x,int y){        if (player[0].isTaken(x,y)) {            return "O";        }   else if (player[1].isTaken(x,y)) return "X";        else return "   ";      }    public boolean isTaken(int x,int y) {        return takenSquare[x][y];    }}
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.

Question: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException why?: :The error is: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerExceptionI would like to make a tic tac toe console game for my university. This is the code belowthe main program:import acm.program.*;public class askisi1d extends Program {    public void run(){        tictac player[];        player=new tictac[2];        player[0]=new tictac("baggelis");        player[1]=new tictac("Giorgaras");        player[0].setMove("1 2");        println(tictac.drawTable());    }}This is the class code:import java.util.*;import acm.program.*;public class tictac{    private String name;    int [][]table=new int [][]{    {8,1,6},    {3,5,7},    {4,9,2}    };    int activePlayer;    boolean [][]takenSquare= new boolean [2][2];    int [][]playerTable; //gia tin niki    static tictac[] player;    private int row;  //<---    private  int col;  //""    public tictac(String name){        this.name=name;        playerTable=new int[2][2];        activePlayer=0;    }    public boolean isValidMove(int row,int col){        return (row>0&&row<4&&col>0&&col<4&&takenSquare[row-1][col-1]==false);    }//isValidmove    public void setMove (String move){        StringTokenizer tokenizer=new StringTokenizer(move);        this.row= Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());        this.col= Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken());        if (isValidMove(row-1,col-1)){            player[activePlayer].takenSquare[row-1][col-1]=true;            player[activePlayer].playerTable[row-1][col-1]=table[row-1][col-1];        }        activePlayer=1-activePlayer;    }    public static String drawTable(){        String a="";        a+=(drawSquare(0,0)+"|");        a+=(drawSquare(0,1)+"|");        a+=(drawSquare(0,2)+'\n');        a+=("-----------")+'\n';        a+=drawSquare(1,0)+"|";        a+=drawSquare(1,1)+"|";        a+=(drawSquare(1,2)+'\n');        a+=("-----------")+'\n';        a+=drawSquare(2,0)+"|";        a+=drawSquare(2,1)+"|";        a+=(drawSquare(2,2));        return"a";    }    public static String drawSquare(int x,int y){        if (player[0].isTaken(x,y)) {            return "O";        }   else if (player[1].isTaken(x,y)) return "X";        else return "   ";      }    public boolean isTaken(int x,int y) {        return takenSquare[x][y];    }}
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer: The error is: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException.

The NullPointerException is thrown when you try to use an object that has not been initialized. In your code, the NullPointerException is thrown in the line `player[0].setMove("1 2");` because `player[0]` is `null`.

To fix this, you need to initialize `player[0]` before calling `setMove`. Here is the corrected code:

```java
public class askisi1d extends Program {
    public void run(){
        tictac player[];
        player=new tictac[2];
        player[0]=new tictac("baggelis");
        player[1]=new tictac("Giorgaras");
        player[0].setMove("1 2");
        println(tictac.drawTable());
    }
}
```

This will initialize `player[0]` to a new `tictac` object with the name "baggelis".

Also, in the `drawTable` method, you are returning the string "a". This is not the table, it's just a single character. You should return the table as a string. Here is the corrected `drawTable` method:

```java
public static String drawTable(){
    String a="";
    a+=(drawSquare(0,0)+"|");
    a+=(drawSquare(0,1)+"|");
    a+=(drawSquare(0,2)+'\n');
    a+=("-----------")+'\n';
    a+=drawSquare(1,0)+"|";
    a+=drawSquare(1,1)+"|";
    a+=(drawSquare(1,2)+'\n');
    a+=("-----------")+'\n';
    a+=drawSquare(2,0)+"|";
    a+=drawSquare(2,1)+"|";
    a+=(drawSquare(2,2));
    return a;
}
```

This will return the table as a string.

Please note that the `tictac` class has a static variable `player` which is not initialized in the `run` method. You should initialize it in the `run` method before using it.

```java
public class askisi1d extends Program {
    public void run(){
        tictac player[];
        player=new tictac[2];
        player[0]=new tictac("baggelis");
        player[1]=new tictac("Giorgaras");
        tictac.player = player; // initialize the static variable player
        player[0].setMove("1 2");
        println(tictac.drawTable());
    }
}
```

This will initialize the static variable `player` in the `tictac` class.

Please note that the `tictac` class has a `setMove` method that uses the `StringTokenizer` class to split the input string into row and column. If the input string is not in the format "row col", the `StringTokenizer` will throw an exception. You should ensure that the input string is in the correct format before calling `setMove`.

I hope this helps to solve your problem. Let me know if you have any other questions.
